ctl:suite.name: sps:suite
ctl:suite.ctl:title: SPS 1.0 Compliance Test Suite
ctl:suite.ctl:description: Verifies that an SPS 1.0 implementation complies with the SPS 1.0 specification.

ctl:test.name: sps:Main
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: The IUT satisfies all applicable assertions.

ctl:code.ctl:message: Testing started at:

body.h2: Compliance Test Suite for Sensor Planning Service (SPS) 1.0
body.p: Please provide a URL from which a Capabilities document can be retrieved. Modify the URL template below to specify the location of an OGC SPS 1.0 implementation to be tested.

ctl:code.ctl:message: Executing tests on the SPS implementation found at the following URL:

ctl:test.name: sps:ows-main
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: All assertions for "ows" conformance are satisfied.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Test driver for the ows module.

ctl:link.title: 1. OWS

ctl:code.ctl:message: Running OWS Common Tests...

ctl:test.name: sps:general-main
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: All assertions for "general" conformance are satisfied.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Test driver for the general module.

ctl:link.title: 2. General

ctl:code.ctl:message: Running General SPS Tests...

ctl:test.name: sps:general-SPS.General-InvalidRequest.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: Sending a request that is non-conformant to a schema associated with an SPS operation causes the server to return a valid error report message with an exceptionCode value of InvalidRequest.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Send several test documents that are invalid according to the schemas associated with some of the SPS operations (i.e. the mandatory operations). Pass if the service returns a valid exception message with an exceptionCode value of InvalidRequest; fail otherwise.

ctl:link.title: Verify that an invalid request produces an appropriate response from the server.

ctl:code.ctl:message: Issuing an invalid request to:
The server returned the following response: ""

xsl:when.ctl:message: FAILURE: The server did not return a response to an invalid request, or the response from the server was not a valid exception report. The response from the server was: ""

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: The response was:
Checking the validity of the response to an invalid request.
The validity check returned:

xsl:if.ctl:message: FAILURE: The response to an invalid request was expected to be an exception report with an exceptionCode of "InvalidRequest" and a locator value containing the validation issue. The returned exception report was: ""

ctl:test.name: sps:general-SPS.General-ValidResponse.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: A response is a valid response for the SPS. This general assertion should be tested by all other tests.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Tested through other tests.

ctl:link.title: Verify that a response entity is schema-valid

ctl:code.ctl:message: This general assertion is tested by all other tests, so there is nothing specific to test now.

ctl:test.name: sps:core-main
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: All assertions for "core" conformance are satisfied.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Test driver for the core module.

ctl:link.title: 3. Core

ctl:code.ctl:message: Running SPS specific GetCapabilities tests...
Issuing a valid GetCapabilities request to
The server responded to a valid GetCapabilities request with the following message:

xsl:when.ctl:message: FAILURE: The server did not return a response to a valid GetCapabilities request, or the response was not a valid SPS Capabilities document.

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: The following URLs will be used for SPS operation specific tests:
DescribeTasking URL:
Submit URL:
DescribeResultAccess URL:

xsl:if.ctl:message: Running DescribeTasking tests...
Running Submit tests...
Running DescribeResultAccess tests...

ctl:code.ctl:message: Testing completed at:

ctl:test.name: sps:core-SPS.GetCapabilities-KVPRequestParameterHandling.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: The server returns a valid error report message with an exception code of MissingParameterValue when mandatory parameters are missing from the request.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Pass if the exception report is valid and the exceptionCode parameter contains MissingParameterValue; fail otherwise.

ctl:link.title: Verify that the server handles missing parameters correctly.

ctl:code.ctl:message: Issuing a GetCapabilities request with no service parameter and no request parameter provided.
The server returned the following response:
Issuing a GetCapabilities request with no service parameter provided.
The server returned the following response:
Issuing a GetCapabilities request with no request parameter provided.
The server returned the following response:

xsl:when.ctl:message: FAILURE: The server did not return responses to the GetCapabilities requests in this test, or the responses to these requests were not valid exceptions.

xsl:if.ctl:message: The response was:
Checking the validity of the response to a GetCapabilities request with no service and no request parameters.
The validity check returned:

FAILURE: The server did not return the expected exception report response to a GetCapabilities request with no request and no service parameters specified. The response was expected to be an ExceptionReport with an exceptionCode of "MissingParameterValue" and a locator of "SERVICE" or "REQUEST". "" was returned instead.
The response was:
Checking the validity of the response to a GetCapabilities request with no service parameter.
The validity check returned:

FAILURE: The server did not return the expected exception report response to a GetCapabilities request with no service parameter specified. The response was expected to be an ExceptionReport with an exceptionCode of "MissingParameterValue" and a locator of "SERVICE". "" was returned instead.
The response was:
Checking the validity of the response to a GetCapabilities request with no request parameter.
The validity check returned:

FAILURE: The server did not return the expected exception report response to a GetCapabilities request with no request parameter specified. The response was expected to be an ExceptionReport with an exceptionCode of "MissingParameterValue" and a locator of "REQUEST". "" was returned instead.

ctl:test.name: sps:core-SPS.GetCapabilities-KVPRequestServiceParameterHandling.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: The server returns a valid error report message with an exception code of InvalidParameterValue when the service key value is not SPS.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Pass if the exception report is valid and the exceptionCode parameter contains InvalidParameterValue; fail otherwise.

ctl:link.title: Verify that the server handles invalid service key values correctly.

ctl:code.ctl:message: Issuing a GetCapabilities request with an invalid service value of ""
The server returned the following response:

xsl:when.ctl:message: FAILURE: The server did not return or a response, or the response was not a valid exception report.

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: The response was:
Checking the validity of the response to a GetCapabilities request with an invalid service value.
The validity check returned:

xsl:if.ctl:message: FAILURE: The response to a GetCapabilities request with an invalid service parameter () does not match the expected response. The response was expected to be an ExceptionReport with an exceptionCode of "InvalidParameterValue" and a locator value of "SERVICE".

ctl:test.name: sps:core-SPS.GetCapabilities-KVPRequestRequestParameterHandling.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: The server returns a valid error report message with an exception code of InvalidParameterValue or OperationNotSupported when the request key value is not GetCapabilities.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Pass if the exception report is valid and the exceptionCode parameter contains InvalidParameterValue or OperationNotSupported; fail otherwise.

ctl:link.title: Verify that the server handles invalid request key values correctly.

ctl:code.ctl:message: Issuing a GetCapabilities request with an invalid request value of ""
The server returned the following response:

xsl:when.ctl:message: FAILURE: The server did not return or a response, or the response was not a valid exception report.

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: The response was:
Checking the validity of the response to a GetCapabilities request with an invalid request value.
The validity check returned:

xsl:if.ctl:message: FAILURE: The response to a GetCapabilities request with an invalid request parameter () does not match the expected response. The response was expected to be an ExceptionReport with an exceptionCode of "InvalidParameterValue" or "OperationNotSupported".

ctl:test.name: sps:core-SPS.GetCapabilities-ResponseMain.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: All assertions related to an SPS GetCapabilities response are valid.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Executes a GetCapabilities request and checks the response for validity

ctl:code.ctl:message: Issuing a valid GetCapabilities request to
The server responded to a valid GetCapabilities request with the following message:

xsl:when.ctl:message: FAILURE: The server did not return a response to a valid GetCapabilities request, or the response was not a valid SPS Capabilities document.
FAILURE: The response to a GetCapabilities request was expected to a Capabilities document; an ExceptionReport was returned instead.

ctl:test.name: sps:core-SPS.GetCapabilities-ResponseOperationMetadataMandatoryOperations.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: The OperationsMetadata section lists the mandatory operations of the SPS.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Pass if the service lists the GetCapabilities, DescribeTasking, Submit, and DescribeResultAccess operations with the proper bindings in the OperationsMetadata section; fail otherwise.

ctl:link.title: Verify that the OperationsMetadata section advertises the mandatory operations of the SPS.

ctl:code.ctl:message: Checking for a GetCapabilities operation...

xsl:if.ctl:message: FAILURE: The GetCapabilities operation is a mandatory operation. Therefore, it must be listed in the OperationsMetadata section of the GetCapabilities document.
FAILURE: The GetCapabilities operation is a mandatory operation. Therefore, a URL must be supplied for the HTTP GET binding for this operation. No URL was supplied for this binding.

ctl:code.ctl:message: Checking for a DescribeTasking operation...

xsl:if.ctl:message: FAILURE: The DescribeTasking operation is a mandatory operation. Therefore, it must be listed in the OperationsMetadata section of the GetCapabilities document.
FAILURE: The DescribeTasking operation is a mandatory operation. Therefore, a URL must be supplied for the HTTP POST binding for this operation. No URL was supplied for this binding.

ctl:code.ctl:message: Checking for a Submit operation...

xsl:if.ctl:message: FAILURE: The Submit operation is a mandatory operation. Therefore, it must be listed in the OperationsMetadata section of the GetCapabilities document.
FAILURE: The Submit operation is a mandatory operation. Therefore, a URL must be supplied for the HTTP POST binding for this operation. No URL was supplied for this binding.

ctl:code.ctl:message: Checking for a DescribeResultAccess operation...

xsl:if.ctl:message: FAILURE: The DescribeResultAccess operation is a mandatory operation. Therefore, it must be listed in the OperationsMetadata section of the GetCapabilities document.
FAILURE: The DescribeResultAccess operation is a mandatory operation. Therefore, a URL must be supplied for the HTTP POST binding for this operation. No URL was supplied for this binding.

ctl:test.name: sps:core-SPS.GetCapabilities-ResponseOperationMetadataOptionalOperations.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: Any non-mandatory operations advertised in the OperationsMetadata section have valid SPS method names.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Pass if the service lists operations in addition to the mandatory operations, and each of the advertised operations has a valid SPS operation name; fail otherwise.

ctl:link.title: Verify that any non-mandatory operations listed in the OperationsMetadata section are valid SPS operation names. This is still up for debate and will probably not be part of the final tests.

ctl:code.ctl:message: Verifying that the provided operations have valid SPS operation names.

xsl:when.ctl:message: FAILURE: The "" operation is not listed in the SPS specification.

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: is a valid SPS operation name.

ctl:test.name: sps:core-SPS.GetCapabilities-ResponseContentsSensorOfferings.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: Each SensorOffering sub-element (AreaOfService, Phenomenon, SensorDefinition, and SensorID) has a value.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Pass if each sub-element of a SensorOffering element has a value; fail otherwise.

ctl:link.title: Verify that each SensorOffering has appropriate values for its sub-elements.

xsl:when.ctl:message: FAILURE: The AreaOfService value for SensorOffering with SensorID is null.

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: Checking AreaOfService value for validity...

xsl:when.ctl:message: ows:WGS84BoundingBox element found. Performing ows:WGS84BoundingBox related tests.
Checking "" for validity...
The ows:WGS84BoundingBox validity check returned:

xsl:if.ctl:message: FAILURE: The WGS84BoundingBox provided in the AreaOfService element for sensorID "" is not a valid WGS84BoundingBox.

xsl:when.ctl:message: ows:BoundingBox element found. Performing ows:BoundingBox related tests.
Checking "" for validity...
The ows:BoundingBox validity check returned:

xsl:if.ctl:message: FAILURE: The BoundingBox provided in the AreaOfService element for sensorID "" is not a valid BoundingBox.

xsl:when.ctl:message: gml:Polygon element found. Performing gml:Polygon related tests.

xsl:if.ctl:message: FAILURE: The gml:pos element provided in the AreaOfService element for sensorID "" is not in a valid format.

xsl:when.ctl:message: gml:pos element found. Performing gml:pos related tests.
Checking "" for validity...
The gml:pos validity check returned:

xsl:if.ctl:message: FAILURE: The gml:pos element provided in the AreaOfService element for sensorID "" is not in a valid format.

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: gml:Solid element found. Performing gml:Solid related tests.

xsl:if.ctl:message: FAILURE: The gml:pos element provided in the AreaOfService element for sensorID "" is not in a valid format.
FAILURE: The Phenomenon value for SensorOffering with SensorID is null or is not a valid URN.
FAILURE: The SensorDefinition value for SensorOffering with SensorID is null.
FAILURE: A SensorID value is null or is not a valid URN.

ctl:test.name: sps:core-SPS.GetCapabilities-ResponseContentsSensorOfferingsValidSensorDefinition.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: The SensorDefinition element of each SensorOffering element links to a valid SensorML or TML document.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Pass if the SensorDefinition element of each SensorOffering element links to a valid SensorML or TML document; fail otherwise.

ctl:link.title: Verify that the value provided in the SensorDefinition field of each SensorOffering links to a valid SensorML or TML document.

xsl:for-each.ctl:message: Issuing a request for the sensor definition of "" to the following URL:
The server returned the following response:

xsl:when.ctl:message: FAILURE: The advertised value in the SensorDefinition element for did not return a response or did not link to a valid SensorML or TML document.

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: A valid SensorML or TML response was returned.
Checking the sensorID of the SensorML or TML response for validity...

xsl:when.ctl:message: A SensorML document was returned. Checking for the existence of a sensorID and verifying that an existing sensorID is valid.
The test discovered the following sensorID:

xsl:if.ctl:message: FAILURE: There was no sensorID specified in the returned SensorML document.
FAILURE: The sensorID in the returned SensorML document () does not match the sensorID specified in the SensorOffering ().

xsl:when.ctl:message: A TML document was returned. Checking for the existence of a sensorID and verifying that an existing sensorID is valid.

xsl:if.ctl:message: FAILURE: There was no sensorID specified in the returned TML document.
FAILURE: The sensorID in the returned TML document () does not match the sensorID specified in the SensorOffering ().

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: FAILURE: The unique identifier for the requested sensor could not be determined from the returned sensor definition document.

ctl:test.name: sps:core-SPS.GetCapabilities-ResponseContentsPhenomenonOfferings.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: Each PhenomenonOffering sub-element (Phenomenon and SensorID) has a value.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Pass if each PhenomenonOffering sub-element has a value; fail otherwise.

ctl:link.title: Verify that each PhenomenonOffering has appropriate values for its sub-elements.

xsl:for-each.ctl:message: Checking the following phenomenon for validity:

xsl:when.ctl:message: FAILURE: The Phenomenon element value for a PhenomenonOffering is an empty string or is not a valid URN.

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: Checking for the existence of a matching phenomenon element in the SensorOfferings...
The check returned:

xsl:if.ctl:message: FAILURE: The Phenomenon element value "" is listed in a PhenomenonOffering, but this phenomenon is not listed in at least one SensorOffering for this service.

xsl:for-each.ctl:message: Checking the following sensorID for validity:

xsl:when.ctl:message: FAILURE: The SensorID element value for the "" PhenomenonOffering is an empty string or is not a valid URN.

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: Checking for the existence of a matching sensorID element in the SensorOfferings...
The check returned:

xsl:if.ctl:message: FAILURE: The SensorID element value "" from the "" PhenomenonOffering is not listed in at least one SensorOffering for this service.

ctl:test.name: sps:core-SPS.GetCapabilities-ValidException.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: An exception message returned by the server is a valid exception message for the GetCapabilities operation.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Pass if the response is a valid exception message for the GetCapabilities operation; fail otherwise

ctl:link.title: Verify that any exception message returned by the server is a valid exception message for the GetCapabilities operation.

xsl:if.ctl:message: FAILURE: The exception report returned is not a valid exception report for the GetCapabilities operation.

ctl:test.name: sps:core-SPS.DescribeTasking-RequestInvalidSensorIDs.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: The server returns a valid error report message with a value of UnknownSensorID for the exceptionCode parameter and a list of the unknown sensor IDs in the locator parameter when one or more invalid sensor ID(s) are supplied in the request.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Pass if the server returns a valid error report message with an exceptionCode parameter of UnknownSensorID and a list of the unknown sensor IDs in the locator parameter; fail otherwise.

ctl:link.title: Verify that the server handles invalid sensor ID(s) correctly.

xsl:variable.name: sensorIDs
xsl:variable.select: string('This is an invalid sensorID 1...,This is an invalid sensorID 2...,This is an invalid sensorID 3...,This is an invalid sensorID 4...')

ctl:code.ctl:message: Sending a DescribeTasking request with the following sensorID elements:
The DescribeTasking request produced the following response: ""

xsl:when.ctl:message: FAILURE: The server did not return a response to an invalid DescribeTasking request or the response was not a valid exception.

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: The response was:
Checking this response for validity...

xsl:if.ctl:message: FAILURE: An exceptionCode of UnknownSensorID was expected in the response. "" was provided instead.
FAILURE: The locator value was expected to contain "".

ctl:test.name: sps:core-SPS.DescribeTasking-RequestNullSensorID.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: The server returns a valid error report message with a value of InvalidParameterValue for the exceptionCode parameter when no SensorID value is supplied in the request.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Pass if the server returns a valid error report message with an exceptionCode parameter of InvalidParameterValue; fail otherwise.

ctl:link.title: Verify that the server handles a request with a null SensorID correctly.

ctl:code.ctl:message: Sending a DescribeTasking request with a null sensorID...

xsl:when.ctl:message: FAILURE: The server did not return a response to an invalid DescribeTasking request or the response was not a valid exception.

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: The response was:
Checking the response for validity...
The validity check returned:

xsl:if.ctl:message: FAILURE: The returned exception report was expected to contain an exceptionCode of InvalidParameterValue and a locator of sensorID.

ctl:test.name: sps:core-SPS.DescribeTasking-ResponseMain.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: The response to a DescribeTasking request is valid.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Pass if each InputDescriptor element contains values for each of its sub-elements and these sub-element values appear to be valid; fail otherwise.

ctl:link.title: Verify a DescribeTasking response.

ctl:code.ctl:message: Iterating through the sensorID elements in the Capabilities document and verifying that a DescribeTasking request produces a valid response for each sensorID...

xsl:when.ctl:message: FAILURE: No response was returned from the server for a DescribeTasking request with sensorID "", or the response did not validate according to the DescribeTasking schema.
The service returned an ExceptionReport. Checking if this ExceptionReport is a valid ExceptionReport for the DescribeTasking operation...
FAILURE: The response to a DescribeTasking request was expected to a DescribeTaskingRequestResponse document; an ExceptionReport was returned instead.

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: Checking the elements of the DescribeTasking response...

ctl:test.name: sps:core-SPS.DescribeTasking-ResponseMatchingSensorIDs.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: The sensorID field of each TaskingDescriptor element is one of the SensorID values provided in the request.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Pass if the SensorID value in each TaskingDescriptor element is one of the SensorID values supplied in the DescribeTasking request; fail otherwise.

ctl:link.title: Verify that the sensorID field of each TaskingDescriptor element is one of the SensorID values provided in the request.

ctl:code.ctl:message: Comparing the requested sensorID "" with the sensorID in the response ""...

xsl:if.ctl:message: FAILURE: The sensorID of the response "" does not match the sensorID in the request "".

ctl:test.name: sps:core-SPS.DescribeTasking-ResponseValidInputDescriptor.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: Each InputDescriptor element contains appropriate values for its sub-elements.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Pass if each InputDescriptor element contains values for each of its sub-elements and these sub-element values appear to be valid; fail otherwise.

ctl:link.title: Verify that each InputDescriptor element contains appropriate values for its sub-elements. This is probably tested through schema validation, so this test may be unnecessary.

ctl:code.ctl:message: Checking all attributes of the DescribeTasking response for validity...

xsl:if.ctl:message: The "" attribute value is null.
The "" attribute value is not a valid URL or OGC URN (i.e. starts with urn:ogc).
The "" attribute value is not a valid URL or OGC definition URN (i.e. starts with urn:ogc:def).

ctl:code.ctl:message: Checking the InputDescriptor constraints for validity...

xsl:if.ctl:message: The "" parameter has one or more invalid constraints.
The "" parameter has one or more invalid values for the interval specified in its constraints.

ctl:test.name: sps:core-SPS.DescribeTasking-ResponseValidInputDescriptorParameterID.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: The parameterID of each InputDescriptor element contains a value.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Pass if the parameterID element of each InputDescriptor element contains a value and each parameterID element has a unique value; fail otherwise.

ctl:link.title: Verify that the parameterID of each InputDescriptor element contains a value.

ctl:code.ctl:message: parameter(s) discovered. Checking parameters...

xsl:if.ctl:message: FAILURE: A parameterID for is null.
FAILURE: One or more parameterID values for are not unique

ctl:test.name: sps:core-SPS.DescribeTasking-ValidException.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: An exception message returned by the server is a valid exception message for the DescribeTasking operation.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Pass if a returned exception message is a valid exception report and has an exceptionCode value that is valid for the DescribeTasking operation; fail otherwise.

ctl:link.title: Verify that any exception message returned by the server is a valid exception message for the DescribeTasking operation

xsl:if.ctl:message: FAILURE: The exception report returned is not a valid exception report for the DescribeTasking operation.

ctl:test.name: sps:core-SPS.Submit-RequestMain.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: All Submit request assertions are satisfied.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Pass if all Submit request assertions are satisfied; fail otherwise.

ctl:code.ctl:message: sensorID values were discovered from the Capabilities document.

body.h2: Please choose a sensor for performing Submit operation tests.

ctl:code.ctl:message: Executing a DescribeTasking request for:

xsl:when.ctl:message: FAILURE: Unable to construct a Submit request form containing taskable parameters, since the server did not return a valid response to the DescribeTasking request for "".

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: A valid DescribeTasking response was returned. Generating a user input form based on the taskable parameters for ...

body.h2: This form allows you to provide values for the parameters of the Submit request that will be sent to . Please provide valid values for all required fields (and optional fields as appropriate). In addition, please provide a value for one or more optional fields if optional fields are available. If valid values are not provided, then the service being tested may fail subsequent Submit tests.

p.h2: Please enter values for a WNS URL and User ID (required)

xsl:when.h2: Please enter valid values for the available taskable parameters for

xsl:otherwise.p:
Please enter valid XML InputParameter elements for the parameters section of a Submit request. These InputParameters will be used in subsequent Submit tests for testing how the SPS implementation handles various valid and invalid Submit requests. Please use the following namespaces in your XML: sps for SPS schema elements, swe for SWE Common schema elements, and gml for GML elements. An example InputParameter element appears below.
<sps:InputParameter parameterID="parameter1"> <sps:value> <swe:Boolean> <swe:value>true</swe:value> </swe:Boolean> </sps:value> </sps:InputParameter>

p.h2:
Please choose a time frame for this tasking. The time frame should be a time that occurs in the future; otherwise, your tasking will most likely be rejected. The supplied value must be an ISO 8601 compliant date/time value (i.e. 2007-12-01T13:21:55.555Z) or duration (i.e. PT5M).
NOTE: The default value that appears below is one hour past the current time, so this value may be used without modification.

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: Valid Submit request constructed:
Submit request constructed with an invalid notificationTarget element:
Submit request constructed with an invalid sensorID element:
Submit request constructed with invalid parameters:
Submit request constructed with missing required parameters:
Submit request constructed with an invalid timeFrame element:
Issuing a valid Submit request...
Valid Submit request submitted at:

ctl:test.name: sps:core-SPS.Submit-RequestInvalidNotificationTarget.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: Invalid data in the notificationTarget element of a Submit request produces a valid exception message.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Pass if a returned exception message is a valid exception report and has an exceptionCode value that is valid for the Submit operation; fail otherwise.

ctl:link.title: Verify that the server handles invalid notification target information correctly. This includes notificationID being null and notificationURL being unresolvable to a valid WNS.

ctl:code.ctl:message: Sending a Submit request with an invalid notificationTarget element...
Response:

xsl:when.ctl:message: FAILURE: The server did not return a response or the response was not valid according to the expected schema when a Submit request with an invalid notificationTarget element was submitted.

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: The response was:
Checking the validity of the response to a Submit request with an invalid notificationTarget element.
The validity check returned:

xsl:if.ctl:message: FAILURE: An exception report with an exceptionCode value of "InvalidParameterValue" and a locator value of "notificationTarget" was expected. "" was returned instead.

ctl:test.name: sps:core-SPS.Submit-RequestSensorParamInvalidSensorID.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: The server returns a valid exception message with a value of UnknownSensorID for the exceptionCode and the unknown sensorID for the locator.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Pass if a returned exception message is a valid exception report and has an exceptionCode value of UnknownSensorID and a locator value listing the unknown sensorID; fail otherwise.

ctl:link.title: Verify that the server returns a valid exception message when an invalid sensorID is provided in the request.

ctl:code.ctl:message: Sending a Submit request with an invalid sensorID element...
Response:

xsl:when.ctl:message: FAILURE: The server did not return a response or the response was not valid according to the expected schema when a Submit request with an invalid sensorID element was submitted.

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: The response was:
Checking the validity of the response to a Submit request with an invalid sensorID element.
The validity check returned:

xsl:if.ctl:message: FAILURE: An exception report with an exceptionCode value of "UnknownSensorID" and a locator value of "" was expected. "" was returned instead.

ctl:test.name: sps:core-SPS.Submit-RequestSensorParamInvalidParameters.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: The server returns a valid Submit response with a status element value of rejected when invalid parameter values are supplied in the request.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Pass if a returned Submit response is valid and the status element has a value of rejected; fail otherwise.

ctl:link.title: Verify that the server returns a Submit response of rejected when invalid parameter values are supplied in the request.

ctl:code.ctl:message: Sending a Submit request with an invalid parameters...
Response:

xsl:when.ctl:message: FAILURE: The server did not return a response, or the response was not valid according to the expected schema when a Submit request with invalid parameter values was submitted.
FAILURE: The response to a Submit request was expected to be a SubmitRequestResponse document; an ExceptionReport was returned instead.

xsl:if.ctl:message: FAILURE: The server returned a valid Submit response, but the status element was expected to be "rejected" instead of "".

ctl:test.name: sps:core-SPS.Submit-RequestSensorParamParametersMissingRequiredParameters.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: The server returns a valid Submit response with a status element value of incomplete request when required parameters are missing from the request.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Pass if a returned Submit response is valid and the status element has a value of incomplete request; fail otherwise.

ctl:link.title: Verify that the server returns a Submit response of incomplete request when required parameters are missing from the request.

ctl:code.ctl:message: Sending a Submit request with missing required parameters...
Response:

xsl:when.ctl:message: FAILURE: The server did not return a response or the response was not valid according to the expected schema when a Submit request with missing required parameters was submitted.

ctl:test.name: sps:core-SPS.Submit-RequestSensorParamParametersExpectedResponse.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: The server returns a valid Submit response with expected values given the parameter values supplied in the request.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Pass if a returned Submit response is valid and the values for the parameters are expected based on the request; fail otherwise.

ctl:link.title: Verify that the server returns an expected Submit response given the parameter values in the request. Test various parameter combinations.

xsl:when.ctl:message: FAILURE: The server did not return a response or the response was not valid according to the expected schema when a Submit request with invalid parameter values was submitted.

p.h2: The server returned the following response to the valid Submit request you created earlier:

xsl:if.ctl:message: FAILURE: The response to a valid Submit request was not what the user expected.

ctl:test.name: sps:core-SPS.Submit-RequestValidTimeFrame.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: The server returns a valid Submit response with a status element value of rejected when an invalid time value (before the current time, etc.) is supplied in the timeFrame parameter.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Pass if a returned Submit response is valid and the status element has a value of "rejected"; fail otherwise.

ctl:link.title: Verify that the server returns a Submit response of rejected when an invalid time value is supplied in the timeFrame parameter.

ctl:code.ctl:message: Sending a Submit request with an invalid timeFrame element...
Response:

xsl:when.ctl:message: FAILURE: The server did not return a response or the response was not valid according to the expected schema when a Submit request with an invalid timeFrame element was submitted.
FAILURE: The response to a Submit request was expected to a SubmitRequestResponse document; an ExceptionReport was returned instead.

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: Checking for a value in the status element. The following value was returned: "".

xsl:if.ctl:message: FAILURE: The server returned a valid Submit response, but the status element value was expected to be "rejected" instead of "".

ctl:test.name: sps:core-SPS.Submit-ResponseMain.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: The response to a valid Submit request contains valid values for its sub-elements
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Pass if the response is a valid SubmitRequestResponse document and the values of the sub-elements are valid

xsl:when.ctl:message: FAILURE: The server did not return a response for the Submit request, or the response was not valid according to the SubmitRequestResponse schema
FAILURE: The response to a Submit request was expected to a SubmitRequestResponse document; an ExceptionReport was returned instead.

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: The Submit response contains the following elements:
Checking these elements for validity...

ctl:test.name: sps:core-SPS.Submit-ResponseValidTaskID.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: The taskID parameter of a Submit response contains a value.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Pass if the response is a valid Submit response and the taskID parameter of the response contains a value; fail otherwise.

ctl:link.title: Verify that the taskID parameter of a Submit response contains a value.

ctl:code.ctl:message: Checking for a value in the taskID element. The following value was returned "".

xsl:when.ctl:message: FAILURE: The taskID in the response for the Submit request was null.

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: The returned taskID "" is valid. Executing DescribeResultAccess tests with this taskID...

ctl:test.name: sps:core-SPS.Submit-ResponseValidEstimatedToC.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: If the estimatedToC element appears in the response, then this element contains a value that is a valid time value that occurs after the time the request was submitted.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Pass if the response is a valid Submit response and the estimatedToC parameter of the response contains a value that is a valid time value and occurs after the time the request was submitted; fail otherwise.

ctl:link.title: Verify that the estimatedToC parameter of a Submit response occurs after the time the request was submitted.

xsl:when.ctl:message: Checking "" for validity...
The validity check returned:

xsl:if.ctl:message: FAILURE: The value in the estimatedToC element () is an invalid time value or does not occur after the time the Submit request was submitted ()

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: FAILURE: The value in the estimatedToC element is null.
An estimatedToC element was not found in the Submit response; therefore, nothing will be tested.

ctl:test.name: sps:core-SPS.Submit-ResponseCorrectUseOfAlternative.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: If the status value is rejected, alternatives available, then a valid value is provided for the alternative parameter. If a value is provided for the alternative parameter, then the status value is rejected, alternatives available.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Pass if the response is a valid Submit response with a status of "rejected, alternatives available" and the alternative parameter is provided and has a value; fail otherwise.

ctl:link.title: Verify that the alternative parameter of a Submit response is used only when the status is rejected, alternatives available.

xsl:if.ctl:message: FAILURE: When the status is "rejected, alternatives available", at least one alternative element should be supplied; when one or more alternative elements are supplied, then the status should be "rejected, alternatives available".

ctl:test.name: sps:core-SPS.Submit-ResponseValidLatestResponseTime.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: The LatestResponseTime value of the Submit response is a valid time value that occurs after the time the request was submitted.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Pass if the response is a valid Submit response with a LatestResponseTime parameter value time occuring after the time the request was submitted; fail otherwise.

ctl:link.title: Verify that the LatestResponseTime parameter of a Submit response occurs after the time the request was submitted.

xsl:when.ctl:message: Checking "" for validity...
The validity check returned:

xsl:if.ctl:message: FAILURE: The value in the LatestResponseTime element () is an invalid time value or does not occur after the time the Submit request was submitted ()

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: FAILURE: The value in the LatestResponseTime element is null.

ctl:test.name: sps:core-SPS.Submit-ValidException.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: An exception message returned by the server is a valid exception message for the Submit operation.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Pass if the response is a valid exception message for the Submit operation; fail otherwise.

ctl:link.title: Verify that any exception message returned by the server is a valid exception message for the Submit operation.

xsl:if.ctl:message: FAILURE: The exception report returned is not a valid exception report for the Submit operation.

ctl:test.name: sps:core-SPS.DescribeResultAccess-RequestNullSensorID.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: A null sensorID in the request produces a valid exception message of InvalidParameterValue with sensorID listed in the locator field.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Pass if the response is a valid exception message with an exceptionCode value of InvalidParameterValue and sensorID listed in the locator field; fail otherwise.

ctl:link.title: Verify that a null sensorID in the request produces a valid exception message of InvalidParameterValue.

Response:

The validity check returned:

xsl:if.ctl:message: FAILURE: The response to a DescribeResultAccess request with a null sensorID parameter was expected to be an exception report with an exceptionCode of "InvalidParameterValue" and a locator value of "sensorID".

ctl:test.name: sps:core-SPS.DescribeResultAccess-RequestInvalidSensorID.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: An invalid sensorID in the request produces a valid exception message of UnknownSensorID.

ctl:test.name: sps:core-SPS.DescribeResultAccess-ResponseSensorIDValidResponse.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: A valid sensorID in the request does not produce a DataNotAvailable response.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Fail if the response is a DataNotAvailable response when the request contained a valid sensorID; pass otherwise.
